result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald J Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

miscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  No drugs or alcohol.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay related costs.  
Pay fine of $1,200.00 plus costs, penalties and surcharges during probation or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.  Bail to apply if applicable.
If revoked, to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

timeConds.notes: Good time credit shall apply.  Release for work and treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald J Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Corrected JOC reflects Sentence date for Probation,  term of Extended Supervision and order for DNA sample

Defendant Donald J Davis in court with attorney Gary S Greenberg.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 60 MONTHS, with credit for 9 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 30 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 30 MONTHS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS
   in the House of Correction.  Goodtime credit shall apply.  Release for work and treatment.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 32 months.
* Court ordered Ignition Interlock for a period of 32 months.
* Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.

Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $1,200.00 plus costs, penalties and surcharges during probation or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit if applicable to be applied.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, recevied and filed.  lms

/from Attorney Greenberg dated 5/22/14, filed with:
 - Defendant's Sentencing Memorandum Re:  Good Time Credit.
/from WCS received and filed.  Defendant compliant. rn

Defendant Donald J Davis in court with attorney Gary S. Greenberg.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date; defendant in treatment.  Court granted defense request and ordered case continued before Branch 20.  WCS report received; defendant compliant.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Donald J Davis in court with attorney Gary S. Greenberg.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 3/21/14.

14RM015491  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 03-17-2014

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  ALSO SCRAM.

Defendant Donald J Davis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Donald J Davis in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
AODA Assessment Form placed in Court File.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
